alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Hancock; Madison; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:53PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Madison, northwestern Hancock, northeastern Marion and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fishers, or 14 miles southwest of Anderson, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Madison, northwestern Hancock, northeastern Marion and southeastern Hamilton Counties, including the following locations... Ingalls, McCordsville, Fortville and Pendleton. This includes Interstate 69 between mile markers 204 and 217. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Indiana.
